messages.message: With this option, any existing ROI will not be used, and gammas from the current source(s) that fall within an existing ROI will not be considered.

Normally ROIs of source peaks are limited in energy range to reduce effects of nearby peaks. With this option, nearby peaks that share the ROI are left in as freely-floating peaks and included in the results.
The energy calibration stays fixed during the fit.
The energy calibration is varied in the fit, but the ROI extent is not updated based on the fit calibration.
Fit NORM peaks (U-238, Ra-226, U-235, Th-232, K-40) using a second relative efficiency curve.

When enabled, the background spectrum is subtracted during peak fitting to determine ROIs to use, but the background is not subtracted for the final fit of peaks that will be returned. Uncheck to fit without background subtraction.
Minimum total chi2 reduction required for peaks in a ROI to be considered significant. The chi2 with peaks must be at least this much lower than chi2 with continuum-only.
Minimum peak significance (peak_area / sqrt(continuum)) for a peak to be considered significant. If any peak in a ROI has significance above this threshold, the ROI is kept.
Threshold for the initial peak significance filter before refitting. Significance = (peak_amplitude * 0.7607) / sqrt(data_area_in_pm_1_fwhm).
Threshold for the final peak significance after refitting. Significance = peak_area / peak_area_uncertainty.
Functional form for detector resolution (FWHM vs energy). Bernstein polynomial order determines how many coefficients are fit.
Form of the relative efficiency curve (e.g. LnXLnY polynomial, or FRAM physical model).
Polynomial order for the relative efficiency equation (when not using the physical model).
There is no foreground spectrum to fit peaks on.
This may take a minute. You can continue using the app.
Spectrum changed before fit completed; discarding results.
No peaks were fit for the selected source(s).
